definition: Small Sytrecian village.
The region near Caten where the Necropolis is located.
A district of Caten.
Small country bordering Suus. The country in which Vis officially claims he was born.
A cliff overlooking the ocean in Suus.
A sea-bound region to the west of Caten.
The Aquirian capital, near which Vis claims he grew up.
The capital of Deditia and of the Catenan Republic, considered to be the centre of the known world.
The Academy which Vis attends, located on the island of Solivagus.
The great stadium in Caten which can house up to one hundred thousand people.
The name used to describe any region governed by Caten's laws.
Country to the south-west of Caten.
The region immediately surrounding Caten.
The capital of Sytrece.
A river in Aquiria.
The stretch of water separating Suus from Aquiria.
A district of Caten.
A Catenan territory.
An Aquirian trading town, located opposite Suus on the Eldargo Strait.
Country whose treaty restricts Catenan ambassadors there from using Will.
Capital of Tensia.
The prison in which Vis works.
A famous landmark in Caten.
A mysterious place, usually referenced alongside Res and Obiteum.
A Catenan territory.
A Catenan territory.
A large area dedicated to the Catenan dead, located in the Agerus region.
Desert-locked country far to the north-east.
A mysterious place, usually referenced alongside Res and Luceum.
District of Caten.
The sea on which both Solivagus and Caten are located.
A mysterious place, usually referenced alongside Obiteum and Luceum.
District of Caten.
A beach in Suus.
Island on which the Academy is located.
Vis's island homeland.
Country to the east of Deditia.
Southernmost populated country in the known world.
